name: Decoction Mash, Double
notes: Used for some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

name: Decoction Mash, Single
notes: Used in some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

name: Decoction Mash, Triple
notes: Authentic Germany mash schedule.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash. Some sources recommend that each decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

name: Decoction Mash, Triple, Lager
notes: Derived from Noonan, "New Brewing Lager Beer".  A pure infusion/decoction mash with no temperature steps.  The book recommends adding boiling water for the second step, though it appears it would come in too high in temperature. The first two decoctions are from the "heaviest" part of mash while the third is from the "thinnest". He also recommends you hold Dextrinization until it passes an iodine test (probably more than 20 minutes)

name: Double Infusion, Full Body
notes: A full bodied mash profile for beers requiring a protein rest.  Used for beer with large portions of unmodified adjuncts such as unmalted wheat.

name: Double Infusion, Light Body
notes: Double step infusion - for light body beers requiring a protein rest.  Used primarily in beers high in unmodified grains or adjuncts.

name: Double Infusion, Medium Body
notes: Double step infusion - for medium body beers requiring a protein rest.  Used primarily in beers high in unmodified grains or adjuncts.

name: Infusion Mash with Precooked Adjuncts
notes: Long protein rests help to break down starches in precooked adjuncts in preparation for saccharification step.

name: Single Infusion, Full Body
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Single Infusion, Full Body, Batch Sparge
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Single Infusion, Full Body, No Mash Out
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Single Infusion, Light Body
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Single Infusion, Light Body, Batch Sparge
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Single Infusion, Light Body, No Mash Out
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Single Infusion, Medium Body
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Single Infusion, Medium Body, Batch Sparge
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Single Infusion, Medium Body, No Mash Out
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Temperature Mash, 1 Step, Full Body
notes: Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove.  Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

name: Temperature Mash, 1 Step, Light Body
notes: Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove.  Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

name: Temperature Mash, 1 Step, Medium Body
notes: Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove.  Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

name: Temperature Mash, 2 Step, Full Body
notes: Two step profile with a protein rest for mashes with unmodified grains or adjuncts.  Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove.  Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

name: Temperature Mash, 2 Step, Light Body
notes: Two step profile with a protein rest for mashes with unmodified grains or adjuncts.  Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove.  Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

name: Temperature Mash, 2 Step, Medium Body
notes: Two step profile with a protein rest for mashes with unmodified grains or adjuncts.  Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove.  Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

name: BIAB, Full Body
notes: Brew in a bag method where the full boil volume is mashed within the boil vessel and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash.  No active sparging is required. This is a full body beer profile.

name: BIAB, Light Body
notes: Brew in a bag method where the full boil volume is mashed within the boil vessel and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash.  No active sparging is required.  This is a light body beer profile.

name: BIAB, Medium Body
notes: Brew in a bag method where the full boil volume is mashed within the boil vessel and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash.  No active sparging is required.  This is a medium body beer profile.

name: BIAB, Pilsner Step Mash
notes: Brew in a bag method where the full boil volume is mashed within the boil vessel and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash.  No active sparging is required. This is a pilsner mash profile that can be used for styles requiring high attenuation and/or modification.

name: RIMS-HERMS Single Infusion, Full Body
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).  Uses infusion for first step and direct heat to reach the mash out temp.

name: RIMS-HERMS Single Infusion, Light Body
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).  Uses infusion for first mash step and direct RIMS/HERMS heat to reach mash out temp.

name: RIMS-HERMS Single Infusion, Medium Body
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).  Uses heated infusion for mash-in and direct heat on RIMS/HERMS system for mash out.

name: BREWHA BIAC, Full Body
notes: Brew in a Conical method where the full boil volume (unless sparging) is mashed within the fermenter (3-in-1 or 4-in-1) and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash.

name: BREWHA BIAC, Light Body
notes: Brew in a Conical method where the full boil volume (unless sparging) is mashed within the fermenter (3-in-1 or 4-in-1) and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash.

name: BREWHA BIAC, Medium Body
notes: Brew in a Conical method where the full boil volume (unless sparging) is mashed within the fermenter (3-in-1 or 4-in-1) and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash.

name: Robobrew Mash and Sparge Full Body
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Robobrew Mash and Sparge Light Body
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

name: Robobrew Mash and Sparge Med Body
notes: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).
